name: Slack
description: Integrate with Slack to post messages and attachments to channels

response_poll_interval.description: How often to poll for a response (in seconds)

actions.verbose: Checks that the provided bot token is valid and grabs information about the configured bot user.

To create a private channel, use the 'channel_type' selection parameter. This action requires a OAuth Access Token defined in the asset. For naming conventions, see https://api.slack.com/methods/conversations.create.

channel_type.description: Type of channel to create (public or private)

actions.description: List public channels of a Slack team
actions.verbose: The output of this action is a list of all public channels in the configured Slack team. The channels will be listed with their corresponding channel IDs.

limit.description: Specify the maximum number of results to return. Default is 100

example_values: This channel is for workspace-wide communication and announcements. All members are in this channel.
Non-work banter and water cooler conversation

actions.description: List users of a Slack team

limit.description: Specify the maximum number of results to return. Default is 100

actions.description: Get information about a user of a Slack team

user_id.description: ID of user to get info of

actions.description: Invite user(s) to a Slack channel
actions.verbose: Up to 1000 users may be added at one time. This action requires a OAuth Access Token defined in the asset. For permissions, see: https://api.slack.com/methods/conversations.invite.

users.description: Comma-separated list of users (IDs) to invite

actions.verbose: The destination parameter can be a channel ID (e.g. C1A1A1AAA), a channel name (e.g. #general), a username (e.g. @user), or a user ID (e.g. U1A1A1AAA). When sending a message to a channel, the configured bot user must have been added to the channel. Specifying a user will send a direct message. Messages are limited to 4000 characters. Note: It is recommended to use channel ID/user ID instead of channel name/username since the latter usage has been deprecated by Slack.

destination.description: Channel (e.g. #channel or C1A1A1AAA) or user (e.g. @user or U1A1A1AAA) to send message to

parent_message_ts.description: Parent message timestamp to reply in thread

reply_broadcast.description: Used in conjunction with 'parent_message_ts' and indicates whether reply should be made visible to everyone in the channel or conversation

example_values: This is a message from Playbook to channel_name

This is test Text File...!!!

Malicious....Me....Not at all...!!!!!

This is test Text File...!!!


Malicious....Me....Not at all...!!!!!

actions.description: React to a message in Slack
actions.verbose: This method adds a reaction (emoji) to a message.

destination.description: Channel ID (C1A1A1AAA) to send message to

message_ts.description: Timestamp of the message to add reaction to

actions.verbose: The destination parameter can be a channel ID (e.g. C1A1A1AAA), a channel name (e.g. #general), or a username (e.g. @user or U1A1A1AAA). When uploading to a channel, the configured bot user must have been added to the channel. Specifying a user will send a direct message containing the file. The file parameter takes the vault ID of a file that will be uploaded to Slack. Only files in the vault can be uploaded to Slack. Note: It is recommended to use channel ID/user ID instead of channel name/username since the latter usage has been deprecated by Slack.

destination.description: Channel (e.g. #channel or C1A1A1AAA) or user (e.g. @user or U1A1A1AAA) to upload to

parent_message_ts.description: Parent message timestamp to reply in thread

file.description: Vault ID of file to upload

caption.description: Caption to add to the file

example_values:
This is test Text File...!!!

Malicious....Me....Not at all...!!!!!

This is test Text File...!!!


Malicious....Me....Not at all...!!!!!

actions.description: Ask a question to a Slack user
actions.verbose:
This action will send a Slack user a direct message containing a question with a series of buttons which represent possible responses. Once the user clicks on one of the responses, Slack will send the response back to Phantom. The action will succeed and output this response in the action result. If the user fails to respond within the timeout configured in the asset, the action will succeed, and output the question ID in the action result. The question ID can be used as input to the get response action.

If the responses parameter is not filled out, the response options will be yes and no.

The confirmation parameter takes a string that will be sent to the user after the user clicks a response. Note: It is recommended to use user ID instead of username since the latter usage has been deprecated by Slack.

destination.description: User (e.g. @user or U1A1A1AAA) to ask question to

example_values: Response received: True, Question id: c2bc5f7cfbb34e13a7ada4aa6e6bb7b5, Response: yes

actions.description: Get the response to a previously asked question
actions.verbose:
The purpose of the 'get response' action is to get the response of a question, asked using the 'ask question' action, that timed out before it could get the response.
The action will check to see if a question has been answered.
  • If the user has answered the question, the question id generated in the 'ask question' action can be used to get the response.
  • If no response is yet available, the action will fail.

actions.description: Start SlackBot and make health checks to it
actions.verbose: Enabling ingestion causes the on poll action to be called every polling interval (configured in ingestion settings). The on poll action will check if SlackBot is running; if it is not, the action will start it. No new containers or artifacts will be created by this action.
This action will stop SlackBot if it is running. It will also disable ingestion if it is enabled.

example_values: SlackBot isn't running, not going to stop it. Ingestion has been disabled.
